title.value: From Assistive Devices to Manufacturing Cobot Swarms
title.justification: The title explicitly mentioned is "From Assistive Devices to Manufacturing Cobot Swarms," which is supported by the mention of applications in manufacturing and industrial settings.
title.quote: From Assistive Devices to Manufacturing Cobot Swarms

extractions.description: The paper provides an overview of the latest trends in robotics, focusing on manufacturing and industrial applications. It emphasizes the role of collaborative robots and swarm robotics in industry, with a detailed case study on Kinova Robotics and its products. The industrial and academic advancements, particularly in collaborative and swarm robotics, are discussed.

type.justification: The paper reviews industrial patents, research papers, and provides a case study of Kinova Robotics, demonstrating its empirical nature as it involves real-world data and case studies.
type.quote: To obtain a general view of current research in the field, we review a selection of industrial patents (Sec. II-A) and research papers (Sec. II-B).

name.justification: The paper discusses various aspects of robotics, including human-robot interaction, collaborative robots, and swarm robotics in industrial contexts, aligning it with the field of Robotics.
name.quote: This paper provides an overview of the latest trends in robotics research and development, with a particular focus on applications in manufacturing and industrial settings.

name.justification: Collaborative robots, also known as cobots, are a primary focus of the paper, especially regarding their application in manufacturing settings.
name.quote: Collaborative robots, also known as cobots, have been developed to work in close proximity with humans without posing a risk to human safety.

name.justification: The paper discusses swarm robotics extensively, especially in the context of manufacturing and industrial applications, highlighting it as a sub-field.
name.quote: Swarm robotics, which aims to overcome the current constraints of, is also tackled in order to let the robot team collectively handle real-world manufacturing difficulties.
